v.v: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered and said,
“When will you stop your talk?
Why are we regarded as beasts, stupid in your sight?
You who tear at yourself in your anger,
Indeed, the light of the wicked person will be put out;
The light will be dark in his tent;
The steps of his strength will be made short;
For he will be thrown into a net by his own feet;
A trap will take him by the heel;
A noose is hidden for him on the ground;
Terrors will make him afraid on every side;
His wealth will turn into hunger,
The parts of his body will be devoured;
He is torn from the safety of his tent
People not his own will live in his tent
His roots will be dried up beneath;
His memory will perish from the earth;
He will be driven from light into darkness
He will have no son or son’s son among his people,
Those who live in the west will be horrified at what happens to him one day;
Surely such are the homes of unrighteous people,

v: Consider, and afterwards we will speak.
should the earth be forsaken for you
or should the rocks be removed out of their places?
the spark of his fire will not shine.
his lamp above him will be put out.
his own plans will cast him down.
he will walk into a pitfall.
a snare will lay hold on him.
and a trap for him in the way.
they will chase him at his heels.
and calamity will be ready at his side.
indeed, the firstborn of death will devour his parts.
and marched off to the king of terrors.
after they see that sulfur is scattered within his home.
above will his branch be cut off.
he will have no name in the street.
and be chased out of this world.
nor any remaining kinfolk where he had stayed.
those who live in the east will be frightened by it.
the places of those who do not know God.”
